bibl.title: Letter from Jennie Carroll to Caroline Latimer, October 4, 1907

div1.p: Carroll thanks Latimer for her sympathy. She notes additional speakers for the meeting at Johns Hopkins.

div1.head: Letter from Jennie Carroll to Caroline Latimer, October 4, 1907
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
October 4th 1907.
Miss Caroline Latimer:
My dear Miss Latimer:
div1.p:
I want to thank
you for your sympathy in
my hours of trouble and sadness,
I have come to the conclusion
that there can be no other loss so
great, as the loss of a husband,
especially so when you are
devoted to one another as my
dear husband and I were, and
now that God has taken him from
me, the only comfort I have, is my
children and to know that he
had the pleasure of having so
many dear friends, and that
he loved his friends)

My dear Miss Latimer,
after writing to Dr. Kelly and
thinking my letter over, I think
I forgot to mention the names
of ✓ Gen. George M. Sternberg who
resides at 2005 Mars. Ave. N. W.
and ✓ Prof. Charles C Munroe of
George Washington University
15th & H.H. N. W. as two more
of the gentlemen I should love
to have speak at the Johns Hopkins
Historical Society Oct. 14. and hope
Dr. Kelly will write to them also,
as well as Dr. Wm. Donnally,
1018 - 14th St. N. W.
Dr. H. H. Donnally is preparing a
a short paper to read, but as he is
in New York, he fears he will not
be able to get back in time, so
I have asked his father to read
his paper, and hope Dr. Kelly.
will not think I am taking a
liberty when I ask this favor; By
the way is this meeting to be a
Public meeting, I have been
asked about it by several of the
Drs., as they expressed wishes to
attend if it were, but I could only
reply; (I do not know) so of you
will kindly let me know, I might
be able to give them the desired
information with kindest regards
to Dr. Kelly I am
div1.closer: Most Sincerely Jennie M. G. Carroll 1433 Clifton St. N. W
